title: Archilogic Editor 4.0: A Comprehensive Rebuild
text:
This case study outlines my role in leading the Archilogic Editor 4.0 rebuild, highlighting my technical skills, strategic thinking, and leadership.



As the product manager in Archilogic, I oversaw the rebuild of Archilogic Editor 4.0, introducing a Spacegraph data structure for floor plans. This project enhanced efficiency and accuracy, improved data security, and streamlined workflows.



Archilogic transforms architectural plans into digital 3D models. The new structure allows seamless integration with advanced algorithms and LLMs, enhancing data processing and analysis. Learn more at Archilogic.







Defined the product vision and strategy.
Created PRDs and wireframes.
Led cross-functional teams through iterative development.
Conducted user research and gathered feedback.
Supported GraphQL API and AI feature rollout.
Ensured stakeholder alignment and communication.







The existing editor had inefficiencies, data integrity issues, and lacked advanced features, affecting professional and non-specialist users.



Addressing these issues was crucial for maintaining competitive edge and meeting user demands by improving user experience, efficiency, and supporting advanced use cases.





Unlock More Features Implement Spacegraph Data structure to enable customers to see benifits of the platform. Enable other key initiatives.
Efficiency: Reduce design iteration time by 50%.
User Experience: Increase satisfaction scores by 30%.
Data Integrity: Reduce data-related errors by 75%.







Internal: Engineering, Design, Sales, Marketing, Customer Support, Finance.
External: Professional customers, Corporate end users.




Regular meetings, PRDs, wireframes, and ongoing communication ensured alignment and informed stakeholders.







Conducted market and user research.

Reviewed all major floor plan tools in the AEC and Operations Spaces for the best workflows, UI and UX features to benchmark ourselves againt.

Identified needs for a more intuitive interface, data integrity, and advanced features.







Focused on creating a robust, user-friendly editor with advanced features. Prioritised features based on user needs, market trends, and technical feasibility.







Rebuilt the editor with a Spacegraph data structure.
Created wireframes and prototypes using Figma.
Conducted user testing and gathered feedback.

title: Archilogic Editor 4.0: A Comprehensive Rebuild
text:
As the lead product manager for Archilogic Editor 4.0, I spearheaded a total rebuild of the editor, introducing a new Spacegraph data structure to represent floor plans as a native planar graph. This project significantly improved the efficiency and accuracy of our design team, involved major changes to how 3D models were drawn and managed, ensured data security, and eliminated workflow bottlenecks.


Archilogic transforms architectural plans into digital, interactive 3D models. These floor plans support relationships as first-class citizens, allowing for seamless integration with advanced algorithms like pathfinding and connectivity analysis. This structure enables immediate compatibility with LLMs for enhanced data processing and analysis, resulting in a highly flexible, intuitive, and robust system for creating, managing, and analyzing floor plans. Learn more at Archilogic.

title: Archilogic Editor 4.0: A Comprehensive Rebuild
text:
Throughout the development of Archilogic Editor 4.0, I utilized Product Requirement Documents (PRDs), wireframes, and hand sketches to communicate key deliverables to our engineering and design teams. The PRDs outlined technical and functional specifications, wireframes provided visual representations of the user interface and workflow, and hand-drawn sketches illustrated complex ideas intuitively. This approach facilitated effective collaboration and alignment across all teams, leading to the successful implementation of the new editor.



Over six months, in two-week cycles, we delivered numerous sub-tasks, including:

Wall Drawing: Placement, editing, and modifying hosting elements like doors and windows.
Window and Door Placement: Configuration and asset placement by users.
Drawing Snaps: CAD import and snaps, keyboard shortcuts.
Parametric Elements: UX/UI for parametric elements, new to the platform.
Performance: Space performance and data validation.
QC Plugins: Power tools for professional users.
Selection Methods: Default color schemes and export formats (PNG, IFC, GLTF, JPG, SVG, CAD).
UI Enhancements: Boundary wall features, unlocking face-based walls with polylines.




While it was tempting to tackle quick wins and related features, it was essential to stay lean and focused. I created an achievable backlog with attainable goals and milestones, balancing ambition with realism, and ensuring each had key outcomes aligned with the core product vision. This approach maintained focus on delivering the most impactful improvements.

title: Archilogic Editor 4.0: A Comprehensive Rebuild
text:
Using Linear.app for ticketing and product management, I created tickets, refined backlogs, assigned priorities, and ran daily standups, weekly refinements, and technical workshops. Key activities included:

Collaborating with engineering, frontend, backend, and the Spacegraph data core team.
Prioritizing tasks to maximize workflow efficiency and unlock other workstreams.
Creating detailed bug reports, testing rigorously, and challenging the editor‚Äôs robustness.




Creating a floor plan editor in a web browser using a planar graph as its basic data structure posed significant challenges. These included:

Representing floor plans in a graph structure while maintaining data integrity.
Handling complex geometries and configurations.
Ensuring smooth transitions and data retention during edge splits and graph reconstructions.

title: Archilogic Editor 4.0: A Comprehensive Rebuild
text:
The successful implementation of Archilogic Editor 4.0 resulted in efficient, accurate, and high-quality floor plans, reflecting the robust capabilities of our new data structure and editor functionalities.


I worked closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and data specialists, to ensure a cohesive development process. Regular standups, technical workshops, and collaborative tools like FigJam and Notion enabled seamless communication and collaboration.



As the lead product manager, I guided the project from inception to completion, setting clear goals and priorities. Utilizing PRDs, wireframes, and sketches, I articulated the vision and deliverables, ensuring everyone had a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities.



Throughout the development process, I provided continuous support to my team through detailed bug reports, rigorous testing, and creating training materials using Loom. I ensured the team had the necessary resources and information to perform their tasks effectively.




Enhanced User Experience: Implemented a user-friendly interface with advanced features like parametric elements and performance enhancements.
Increased Efficiency: Developed tools and functionalities that streamlined workflows, reducing the time and effort required for design iterations and data management.
Robust Data Structure: Introduced the Spacegraph data structure, ensuring better data integrity and security while handling complex geometries.
Achievable Backlog: Maintained a realistic and focused backlog, ensuring that each milestone was met with key outcomes aligned with the core product vision.
Effective Tool Utilization: Leveraged various tools (Loom, Lookback, Linear.app, Notion, Figma, FigJam) to enhance collaboration, project management, and user testing.

Overall, the Archilogic Editor 4.0 project showcased my ability to lead a comprehensive rebuild, ensuring that our product met the highest standards of quality and performance while fostering a collaborative and supportive team environment.
